note_en:
The Fortnite Mega Drop is here! Get up to 20% savings on V-Bucks and real-money offers for every purchase on PlayStation, Xbox, Nintendo Switch, PC, and Mac, and on mobile when using select payment methods.  This isn’t a sale…  these are new discount prices available anytime! We’re excited to pass along these savings to you and will continue to look for additional ways to bring value to all Fortnite players. Here’s how to snag your savings.
  Starting today, any V-Bucks or real-money offers you purchase on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Nintendo Switch, PC, and Mac are now discounted by up to 20%. You don’t need to do anything!
  Today, we’re also introducing a new way to pay on iOS and Android: Epic direct payment. When you choose to use Epic direct payments, you save up to 20% as Epic passes along payment processing savings to you.  Grab the latest Fortnite update to begin saving today! Here’s how it works:
    Currently, when using Apple and Google payment options, Apple and Google collect a 30% fee, and the up to 20% price drop does not apply. If Apple or Google lower their fees on payments in the future, Epic will pass along the savings to you.
  Epic direct pay is supporting many countries and the list will grow. Visit our  supported countries and currencies page for iOS players and Android players using the Google Play Store.
  Do you play Fortnite on Android, but don’t purchase through Google Play? No problem! You’ll find that V-Bucks and real-money offers are now discounted by up to 20% through the Epic Games app at  epicgames.com and the  Samsung Galaxy Store.
  What does 20% off V-Bucks mean?  V-Bucks and real-money offers can now be purchased at new prices discounted up to 20% on console and PC/Mac. On mobile, you can select Epic direct payment to get your new discount (not yet available in all countries - more countries coming soon).   What if I recently purchased V-Bucks?  Players that purchased V-Bucks or purchased a real-money offer like Summer Legends in the last 30 days (July 14, 2020 - August 13, 2020) will be granted a V-Bucks bonus by August 17! The V-Bucks bonus will be 20% of the total purchase amount during that time frame.  To celebrate the Fortnite Mega Drop, we’re gifting all active players the Shooting Starstaff Pickaxe for FREE. Enjoy and thank you for being a part of the community!      What does the Fortnite Mega Drop mean for Support-A-Creator payments?  Players can now purchase more V-Bucks for less, but your Support-A-Creator rates will remain the same. For every 2,000 V-Bucks spent, you’ll still receive $1.00 USD.  So when players spend the same amount of money in Fortnite as they have previously, creators can now earn even more when those additional V-Bucks are spent!   What if my currency is NOT supported with Epic direct payment?  As we begin to support more currencies for Epic direct payment, we will update players.   More questions?  Get more details in our  Epic Direct Payments Blog, or check out our  Fortnite Mega Drop Press FAQ.
title: EPIC手机直接支付

Docker服务条款是您与Docker之间的协议，规范您对Docker产品和服务的使用。单击该链接可查看完整的Docker服务条款。
最显著的变化是在第2.5节中。要查看所有更改，我们建议您阅读完整的Docker服务条款。
映像保留基于存储在用户帐户中的每个单独映像的活动。如果在您的订阅计划中指定的时间内没有拉入或推送映像，则该映像将被标记为“非活动”。任何标记为“非活动”的映像都将被安排删除。只有自由个人或组织计划中的帐户才会受到映像保留限制。Docker Hub中还将提供一个新的仪表板，使您能够查看所有容器映像的状态。
Docker即将推出容器镜像保留政策，将于2020年11月1日起执行。容器镜像保留政策将适用于以下计划：
从2020年11月1日开始，任何标记为“非活动”的映像都将被计划删除。帐户所有者还将收到有关计划删除的“非活动”图像的电子邮件通知。
图像保留限制仅适用于免费个人和组织帐户。拥有专业或团队帐户的用户不受保留限制。如果你有一个免费账户，你可以很容易地升级到专业或团队账户，每月5美元起，并提供年度计划。有关详细信息，请转到：https://www.docker.com/pricing定价和订阅常见问题解答返回页首
note_en:
The Docker Terms of Service is an agreement between you and Docker that governs your use of Docker products and services. Click on the link to view the full  Docker Terms of Service.
    The most notable changes are in Section 2.5. To see all of the changes, we recommend you read the full  Docker Terms of Service.
  Image retention is based on the activity of each individual image stored within a user account. If an image has not either been pulled or pushed in the amount of time specified in your subscription plan, the image will be tagged “inactive.” Any images that are tagged as “inactive” will be scheduled for deletion. Only accounts that are on the  Free individual or organization plans will be subject to image retention limits. A new dashboard will also be available in Docker Hub that offers the ability to view the status of all of your container images.
  Docker is introducing a container image retention policy which will be enforced starting November 1, 2020. The container image retention policy will apply to the following plans:
  Beginning November 1, 2020, any images that are marked as “inactive” will be scheduled for deletion. Account owners will also be notified by email of “inactive” images that are scheduled for deletion.
  Image retention limits only apply to  Free individual and organization accounts. Users with  Pro or  Team accounts are not subject to retention limits. If you have a  Free account, you can easily upgrade to a  Pro or  Team account starting at $5 per month with an annual plan. For more information go to:  https://www.docker.com/pricing      Pricing and Subscriptions FAQ      Back to TOP
title: Docker更新ToS：对免费帐户施加映像保留限制
title_en: Docker update ToS: Image retention limits imposed on free accounts

note:
你好，我叫伊万·库茨基，今年29岁。我住在捷克共和国的布拉格。我创建了Photopea，这是一个可以在网络浏览器中使用的高级图像编辑器。7月份有700万游客。
我从2012年开始创作，2013年出版了第一版，这只是我的爱好，直到2016年我毕业并开始全职创作。直到2017年，我才完全相信Photopea，当时我开始(通过广告)将其货币化，每月能赚400美元：)。
一年多前，我在Reddit上做了一个AMA，我想告诉你从那以后发生了什么：)。
我添加了对曲线上的文本、更智能的选择、打开Figma文件、木偶扭曲、内容感知缩放、改进的PDF支持等等的支持。
尽管我收到了几份投资要约，但Photopea仍然没有被任何人收购。
我仍然独自在Photopea工作，但我想雇用更多的人(有人可以与我一起工作)。在某个时候，我也想开始制作一个视频编辑器。问我任何问题！：)。
您可以在Facebook或Twitter上关注Photopea！证据：我在这里放了一个这个美国医学会的链接！
note_en:
Hi, my name is Ivan Kutskir, I am 29 y.o. and I live in Prague, the Czech Republic. I created  Photopea , an advanced image editor which works in a web browser. There were 7 million visitors in July.
 I started to work on it in 2012, the first version was published in 2013, it was just my hobby until 2016, when I graduated and started to work on it full-time. I did not fully "believe" in Photopea until 2017, when I started to monetize it (with ads) and was able to make $400 a month :)
 I had an AMA on Reddit  over a year ago and I would like to tell you what happened since then :)
 I added the support for  text on a curve,  smarter selections,  opening Figma files,  puppet warp, content-aware scale, improved PDF support and more
  Photopea still wasn't acquired by anyone, even though I received several offers of an investment
 I still work on Photopea alone, but I would like to hire more people (someone I can work with in person). I would like to start making a video editor, too, at some point. Ask me Anything! :)
 You can follow Photopea on  Facebook or  Twitter! Proof: I put a link to this AMA  here!
title: AMA与Photopea的创建者
title_en: AMA with the Creator of Photopea

note:
上个月，谷歌宣布对Gmail进行重大改造，将其与谷歌的两款较新的通讯应用Google Meet和Google Chat合并。这两款应用都是后起之秀，在谷歌长期忽视的领域与老牌竞争对手展开竞争。Meet是Google的Zoom视频会议竞争对手，而Google Chat是该公司的Slake竞争对手。今天，谷歌宣布合并开始向GSuite客户推出。
在桌面界面上，新版本的Gmail保留了所有的Gmail命令和功能，只是在电子邮件应用程序的侧面和顶部增加了100万个其他控件。侧边栏现在有了谷歌聊天中的人物部分和聊天室，以及你在Google Meet中安排的会议。Gmail的消息区有一个分屏界面，现在可以在Gmail中显示谷歌聊天聊天室，甚至打开谷歌文档。
在移动设备上，Gmail应用程序在应用程序的底部有一个新的选项卡栏，可以让你在邮件、聊天、房间和会议之间切换。
合并完全是可选的，在GSuite中，更改只会出现在启用了首选聊天选项的组织中。谷歌的推出策略意味着，一项功能永远不会一下子对所有人开放，而GSuite更是如此，它有两条推出路线：
快速发布域：从2020年8月12日开始逐步向用户推出(最多15天，以获得完整的功能可见性)。
预定版本域：从2020年9月1日开始逐步向用户推出(最多15天，以获得完整的功能可见性)。
目前，这款应用仅针对Gmail的网络应用程序和Android应用程序。谷歌表示，请随时关注GSuite博客，以获取iOS应用程序发布时间的最新消息。
对于谷歌的普通消费者账户，他们不会在桌面上看到这种合并。谷歌表示，它正在积极考虑如何以及何时将这种体验带给可能需要它的消费者。
在移动领域，消费者正在经历一场合并，这是与Gmail和Google Meet的合并。这一变化也于本周开始推出。消费者Gmail应用程序一直在从GSuite的四个按钮选项卡栏中移除，并将其削减为两个按钮：邮件和会议，基本上使其成为Google Meet的一个大横幅广告。同样，这是可选的，尽管默认情况下它是打开的。您可以通过转到设置->[您的电子邮件地址]并取消选中显示视频通话的会议选项卡来将其关闭。&#34；如果您在Gmail中有多个帐户，则需要为每个帐户执行此操作。
在Gmail中内置Meet and Chat，基本上就是谷歌将我们的新产品推入Gmail的旧谷歌时尚战略的复活。当时，谷歌担心的是Facebook和Twitter，而不是Zoom和Slake，但这是同样的基本计划。人们在Gmail上花费了大量时间，谷歌希望他们能在同一个应用程序中进行工作聊天和视频会议。对于GSuite的用户来说，问题是无论如何你都要为GSuite付费，所以你最好也停止为Slake和Zoom付费。
note_en:
Last month, Google announced  a major revamp of Gmail that would see it merge with two of Google's newer communication apps, Google Meet and Google Chat. Both apps are upstarts taking on established competitors in areas Google has neglected for a long time. Meet is Google's Zoom video conferencing competitor, and Google Chat is the company's Slack competitor. Today, Google announced the merger is  starting to roll out to GSuite customers.
 On the desktop interface, the new version of Gmail keeps all of the Gmail commands and features about where you would expect them, it just adds a million other controls to the sides and top of the email app. The sidebar now has sections for people and chat rooms from Google Chat, along with meetings you have scheduled in Google Meet. Gmail's message area gets a split-screen interface that can now do things like show a Google Chat chatroom or a even open a Google Doc right inside Gmail.
 On mobile, the Gmail app gets a new tab bar at the bottom of the app, letting you switch between Mail, Chat, Rooms, and Meet.
 The merger is totally optional, and in GSuite the change will only appear for organizations that have the " Chat preferred" option enabled. Google's rollout strategy means a feature never arrives for everyone all at once, and that's doubly true for GSuite, which has two rollout tracks:
 Rapid Release domains: Gradual rollout to users (up to 15 days for full feature visibility) starting on August 12, 2020
 Scheduled Release domains: Gradual rollout to users (up to 15 days for full feature visibility) starting on September 1, 2020
 For now, the rollout is for Gmail's Web app and the Android app. Google says to "stay tuned" to the GSuite blog for updates on the timing of the iOS app.
 For regular consumer Google accounts, they won't see the merger on desktop. Google said it was "actively thinking through how and when to bring this experience to the consumers who might want it.”
  On mobile, there is a bit of a merger happening for consumers, and that's with Gmail and Google Meet. That change also started rolling out this week. The consumer Gmail app has been taking the four-button tab bar from GSuite and cutting it down to two buttons: Mail and Meet, basically making it a big banner ad for Google Meet. Again, this is optional, though it's on by default. You can turn it off by going to Settings-> [Your email address] and unchecking "Show the Meet tab for video calling." If you have multiple accounts in Gmail, you'll need to do this for each account.
 Building Meet and Chat into Gmail is basically Google resurrecting the old Google Buzz strategy of "Shove our new product into Gmail." Back then, Google's worry was Facebook and Twitter instead of Zoom and Slack, but it's the same basic plan. People spend a lot of time in Gmail, and Google hopes they'll want to do their work chat and video conferencing in the same app. For users of GSuite, the pitch is that you're paying for GSuite anyway, so you might as well stop paying for Slack and Zoom, too.
title: Gmail的一体化生产力改造开始向GSuite用户推出
title_en: Gmail’s all-in-one productivity revamp starts rolling out to GSuite users

note:
至少有十几个行业处于不断变化的状态，只有时间(相对较短的时间)才能证明它们是否能发展得足够快，以保持在游戏中。其中一些行业包括媒体、直接面向消费者的零售、旅游和酒店业。随着变化的步伐急剧加快，可能很难对这些各自的市场和更广泛的科技初创公司格局做出正面或反面的了解。
幸运的是，Lerer Hippeau的联合创始人兼管理合伙人Eric Hippeau处于独特的位置，可以回答我们最紧迫的问题，特别是围绕这些行业的问题。我们非常高兴地与您分享，Hippeau今天将和我们一起收看一集Extra Crunch Live。额外的Crunch会员可以现场收看这一集，并直接向Hippeau提出他们自己的问题，时间是太平洋时间上午11点/东部时间下午2点/格林威治时间下午6点。
埃里克·希佩奥在与人共同创立莱勒·希佩奥之前曾担任赫芬顿邮报的首席执行官。他还曾担任Ziff-Davis的董事长兼首席执行官，Ziff-Davis曾是计算机杂志的顶级出版商。他是BuzzFeed和万豪国际的董事会成员。
Lerer Hippeau投资组合公司包括Axios、BuzzFeed、Genius、Chartbets和Giphy。虽然该公司在媒体方面有经验，但这并不意味着投资组合完全专注于媒体。其他投资组合公司包括Casper、WayUp、Warby Parker、Mirror、HungryRoot、Glossier、Everlan、Brit+Co.和AllBirds，仅举几例。
我们将与Hippeau讨论快速变化的媒体格局，直接面向消费者的公司如何在冠状病毒带来的新世界中生存(在某些情况下，如何利用)，并就如何向Lerer Hippeau推销投资提供一些建议。
我还对勒勒·希佩奥(Lerer Hippeau)对初创工作室(Betaworks和Expa)的投资感到好奇，并想了解进入2020年下半年，哪些行业对公司最具吸引力。
如前所述，额外的Crunch会员可以在聊天过程中提出他们自己的问题。如果您还不是Crunch的额外会员，您可以在这里注册。
我们很高兴能邀请到Hippeau加入我们，我们希望你也能加入我们！
note_en:
At least a dozen industries are in a state of flux, and only time (a relatively short amount of time) will tell if they can evolve quickly enough to stay in the game. A few of those industries include media, direct-to-consumer retail, travel and hospitality. With the pace of change up dramatically, it can be difficult to make heads or tails of these respective markets and the broader tech startup landscape.
 Luckily,  Eric Hippeau,   cofounder and managing partner at Lerer Hippeau, is uniquely positioned to answer our most pressing questions, particularly around these industries. We’re very pleased to share with you that Hippeau will be joining us today for an episode of Extra Crunch Live.  Extra Crunch members can catch the episode live, and ask their own questions directly to Hippeau, at 11am PT/2pm ET/6pm GMT.
 Eric Hippeau served as CEO for the Huffington Post before co-founding  Lerer Hippeau  . He also served as chairman and CEO at Ziff-Davis, a former top publisher of computer magazines. He sits on the boards of BuzzFeed and Marriott International.
 Lerer Hippeau portfolio companies include Axios, BuzzFeed, Genius, Chartbeat and Giphy. And while the firm has experience in media, that doesn’t mean the portfolio is squarely focused on it. Other portfolio companies include Casper, WayUp, Warby Parker, Mirror, HungryRoot, Glossier, Everlane, Brit + Co. and AllBirds, to name just a few.
 We’ll chat with Hippeau about the rapidly changing media landscape, how direct-to-consumer companies can survive (and in some cases, capitalize) on the new world ushered in by the coronavirus, and get some pointers on how to pitch Lerer Hippeau for investment.
 I’m also curious about Lerer Hippeau’s investment in startup studios (Betaworks and Expa) and to learn which sectors seem most attractive to the firm going into the back half of 2020.
 As previously mentioned, Extra Crunch members can ask their own questions during the chat. If you’re not yet an Extra Crunch member, you can  sign up right here.
 We’re amped to have Hippeau join us and we hope you will, too!
title: Extra Crunch Live：与Eric Hippeau一起在美国东部时间上午11点/下午2点接受现场问答
title_en: Extra Crunch Live: Join Eric Hippeau for a live Q&A today at 11am PT/2pm ET

note:
Cube首席执行官兼创始人克里斯蒂娜·罗斯(Christina Ross)告诉TechCrunch，她从3月份开始筹集最新一批资本，几周内就拿到了几份条款说明书。最终，这家创业公司选择了Bonfire Ventures的布雷特·奎纳(Brett Queener)领导这轮融资，运营商Collective、钟塔科技风险投资公司(ClockTower Technology Ventures)、校友风险投资集团(Alumni Ventures Group)、科技之星(Techstar)等公司也参与其中。
那么，什么是FP&amp；A，为什么Cube会吸引这么多感兴趣的投资者呢？我们两个都来谈吧。
今天早上，我找不到一个古老的创业公司的来源，但大致是这样的：如果你想知道在哪里可以找到一家创业公司，就去找一家大公司，四处走走，直到你找到他们还在使用电子表格的地方，然后建立一些可以取代它们的东西。瞧，你有一家公司了。
她在一次采访中详细介绍了自己的工作经历，指出曾在通用电气(GE)、德勤(Deloitte)从事财务工作，在Rent the Runway担任34名员工和第一任财务主管，在Criteo担任北美财务主管，最后在Eyeview担任首席财务官。她帮助成长中的公司管理和跟踪他们的货币资源，并为未来制定计划。
或者用行业的话说，她花了很多时间做FP&amp；A，她说，在这个业务流程中，仍然有太多老式的电子表格。
这就是Cube的用武之地。罗斯在我们的谈话中指出，CFO做的很多事情都是自动化的，使用Carta、Bill.com、Expensify和其他工具，但FP&amp；A仍然是一种糟糕的体验。
Cube所做的是将公司的总账(比如Quickbook)、CRM(比如Salesforce)和HRIS(也许是ADP)中的信息收集到一个存储库中。从那里，该公司的FP&Amp；A员工可以控制和分类数据，使用Cube自己的可视化工具、电子表格或Web界面查看数据。
一旦您能够以您选择的方式查看信息，您就可以开始FP&A的真正工作，即勾勒出未来。那个小品有什么用处？为公司领导层提供盈亏预测和其他运营细节。
在罗斯的概念中，FP&Amp；A实际上相当简单。把所有的数字放在一边，它只是在讲述过去的故事，并为任何一家给定的公司写下未来的故事。
这是一个很好解决的问题，而且Cube可以收取很高的费用来帮助解决这个问题。该公司的服务起价为每月850美元，之后开始上涨(这家初创公司还提供打折的创业计划)。
但是别担心，Cube并不是想要开发一个稍微好一点的笔记应用程序，然后乞求人们取悦它，请为它支付微薄的费用。这家初创公司希望打造公司财务大脑的一部分。而且，由于其产品将紧挨着支出和现金的结合点，这家初创公司要求的费用可能比我们经常看到的任务关键度较低的SaaS产品的费用更高，这可能是正确的。
我们认为，它的商业重要性和价位是Cube在大流行期间没有努力筹集资金的部分原因。这家总部位于纽约市的初创公司计划在明年将员工规模增加两倍，因为它已经结束了融资周期。
Cube的软件不是我会用到的东西，但在一家初创公司开始成熟其会计和财务功能时，我已经在那里了。仅仅是把数字排成一条线是一件很困难的事情，更不用说把书写得如此完美了，以至于你可以抬起眼睛从小字上看一眼地平线。如果Cube能够帮助更多的公司做到这一点，它自己就可以做得很好。
note_en:
Christina Ross, Cube’s CEO and founder, told TechCrunch that she started raising the most recent tranche of capital in March, winding up with a few term sheets within a few weeks. Eventually the startup picked  Bonfire Ventures‘  Brett Queener to lead the round, with  Operator Collective,  Clocktower Technology Ventures,  Alumni Ventures Group,  Techstars, and others taking part.
 So, what is FP&A and why is  Cube   attracting so many interested investors? Let’s talk about both.
   There’s an old startup chestnut that I can’t source this morning, but goes something like this: If you want to know where to found a startup, just go to a big company, walk around until you figure out where they still use spreadsheets, and build something that will replace them.  Voilà, you have a company.
  She detailed her work experience in an interview, noting stints at  GE, at  Deloitte doing financial work, at  Rent The Runway as employee 34 and first head of finance, at  Criteo where she was its North America head of finance, and, finally, at  Eyeview as its CFO. She has helped growing companies manage and track their monetary resources, and draw a plan for the future.
 Or in industry-speak, she has spent a lot of time doing FP&A, a business process where she says there are still too many old-fashioned spreadsheets.
 That’s where Cube comes in. Ross noted during our chat that lots of what a CFO does is being automated, with Carta, Bill.com, Expensify, and other tools, but that FP&A is still something of a crap experience.
 What Cube does is collect information from a company’s general ledger (think Quickbooks), CRM (say, Salesforce), and HRIS (ADP, perhaps) into a single repository. From there the company’s FP&A denizens can control and sort the data, viewing it using Cube’s own visualization tool, spreadsheets, or web interface.
 Once you can see the information in a manner of your choosing, you can get to the real work of FP&A, namely sketching out the future. What is that sketch good for? Providing a company’s leadership with profit and loss forecasting, and other operating details.
 In Ross’s conception, FP&A is actually pretty simple. Put away all the numbers, it’s just telling the story of the past, and writing the story of the future for any given company.
 It’s a neat problem to solve, and one that Cube can charge handsomely for helping with. Pricing  for the company’s service starts at $850 per month, and goes up from there (the startup also offers a discounted startup plan).
 But don’t worry, Cube isn’t trying to build a slightly better note taking app and then begging people to please,  please pay for a pittance for it. The startup wants to build a part of companies’ financial brains. And as its product will sit next to the nexus of spend and cash, the startup is probably right to demand a higher fee than we often see from less mission-critical SaaS products.
 Its business-importance and price point, we presume, were part of why Cube didn’t struggle to raise during a pandemic. Based in New York City, the startup intends to triple its staff size in the next year now that it has closed its funding cycle.
 Cube’s software isn’t something that I’ll ever use, but I’ve been at a startup at the time when it began to mature its accounting and finance functions. It’s a struggle to just get the numbers in line, let alone get the books so perfect that you can raise your eyes from the fine print to glance at the horizon. If Cube can help more companies do just that, it could do well for itself.
title: Cube完成500万美元的种子融资，以扩大其财务规划软件的规模
title_en: Cube closes $5M Seed round to scale its financial planning software

note:
事实上，SaaS和其他云公司的估值在2020年达到了新的高度，随着它们自己的价值飙升，推动了更大的股市上涨。这些泡沫、繁荣的时代使得将软件带入更大的全球经济新领域的更大努力更加令人兴奋。
毕竟，如果上市SaaS公司的价值比以往任何时候都高，那么初创公司本身的价值就会更高，这意味着应该有更多的资本涌入那些希望将软件吞噬世界的年轻公司从口号变成现实的公司。
为了挖掘今年的SaaS市场，我们组织了一个由知名投资者组成的小组，在9月14-18日的Disrupt大会上与TechCrunch聊天。我们将带来迦南合伙公司的Maha Ibrahim，Andreessen Horowitz的David Ulevitch，以及Bessemer Venture Partners的玛丽·多诺弗里奥，帮助我们解释改变后的世界。(精明的读者可能还记得，D‘Onofrio经常以SaaS专家的身份额外露面。)。
我们想知道新冠肺炎时代的增长加速对2020年融资有多重要，在这个新世界里，哪些指标对投资阶层最具吸引力，以及在哪里部署新的、令人兴奋的软件即服务。而且，如果聚集的投资者中有任何人感到辛辣，如果SaaS市场有任何被过度炒作或估值过高的地方，也可能会出现这种情况。
SaaS已经成为大多数初创公司事实上的商业模式，而在SaaS本身内部，专注于业务重点的初创公司正在占据可用风险资本的很大一部分。我们将深入研究为什么会出现这种情况，以及这对处于不同成熟阶段的初创企业有何影响。
今天就拿着你的通行证参加Disrupt，检查这次会议等等。注册后，您还可以访问CrunchMatch平台，这样您就可以立即开始与TechCrunch社区建立联系。请在这里领取通行证。
note_en:
Indeed, SaaS and other cloud companies have seen their valuations reach new heights in 2020, pushing the larger stock market up as their own worth soared. These  frothy, booming times make the larger effort to take software into new parts of the larger global economy all the more exciting.
 After all, if public SaaS companies are worth more than ever, startups themselves are inherently worth more, which means that even more capital should pour into the young companies that want to transform  software eating the world from catchphrase into reality.
  To dig into the SaaS market this year, we’ve compiled a panel of well-known investors to chat with TechCrunch at  Disrupt this September 14-18. We’re bringing  Canaan Partners‘  Maha Ibrahim,  Andreessen Horowitz’s  David Ulevitch, and  Bessemer Venture Partners’  Mary D’Onofrio to help explain the changed world to us. (Astute readers will recall that D’Onofrio makes  regular Extra Crunch appearances as a SaaS guru.)
 We want to know how important seeing a COVID-19-era growth  acceleration is to raising capital in 2020, what metrics are most attractive to the investing classes in this new world, and where SaaS is being deployed that’s new, and exciting. And, maybe, if any of the assembled investors are feeling spicy, if any bit of the SaaS market is overhyped, or overvalued.
 SaaS has become the de facto business model for what feels like the majority startups, and inside of SaaS itself a focus on  business-focused upstarts are taking a large slice of available venture capital. We’ll dig into why that’s the case, and how that impacts startups at different stages of maturity.
 Grab your pass today to attend Disrupt to check out this session and so much more. You will also get access to the  CrunchMatch platform after registering so you can start networking right away with the TechCrunch community.  Get your pass here.
title: 我们将在今年的Disrupt大会上探索SaaS的未来
title_en: We’re exploring the future of SaaS at Disrupt this year

note:
像许多行业一样，过去的五个月对电影院来说绝对是毁灭性的。就销量而言，没有哪家影院比世界上最大的连锁影院受到的打击更大。AMC重新开放影院的计划已经有一段时间了-但情况发生了变化，特别是当你正在应对像全球大流行这样不确定和不断演变的事情时。
本周，这家剧院巨头宣布计划于8月20日在美国重新开放100多家电影院，这构成了第一波重新开放的浪潮。为了吸引可以理解的谨慎的顾客回来，它将只提供一天0.15美元的所有门票(由于它执行社会距离措施，数量有限)。这个数字是对1920年门票价格的短暂回归，以向连锁店的创立者致敬。
事情仍然是…。当然，这很棘手。这里更大的问题之一是目前缺乏新的发行版本可供选择。这是鸡和蛋的交易之一。电影制片厂同样渴望发行电影，但运气不佳，因为当地法规让影院保持关闭。在多次推迟之后，华纳兄弟宣布将采取不同寻常的措施，在克里斯托弗·诺兰(Christopher Nolan)的“Tenet”进入美国之前，先在美国境外首映。最重要的是，这清楚地表明了这个国家对新冠肺炎的处理。
随着Tenet和New Mutants等电影的蓄势待发，AMC将依靠更老的大片来试图让屁股回到座位上。即将上映的电影包括“帝国反击战”、“黑豹”、“回到未来”、“捉鬼敢死队”和“油脂”。这些电影的价格将为每部5美元，旨在吸引那些迫不及待地想要返回影院体验的人，无论是否有新的上映。
当然，当AMC宣布口罩对电影观众来说是自愿的时，它就成为了争议的主题，在网上的强烈反弹后，AMC很快收回了这一立场。注意到重新开放的新闻稿包括一份卫生和安全措施的洗衣单，
AMC Safe&amp；Clean组件包括大幅降低每次放映时间的最大门票和预留座位礼堂的座位阻塞，以允许派对之间适当的社交距离；增强的清洁程序，包括放映时间之间的额外时间，以便利用静电喷雾器进行全面、彻底的清洁和夜间消毒；使用高科技HEPA吸尘器；升级空气过滤努力，包括尽可能使用MERV 13过滤器；新的客人和相关安全协议，包括强制所有客人和同事佩戴口罩；整个手部消毒站。
影院列表可以在这里找到。它仅限于少数几个城市和州，跳过了加州和纽约等关键市场，可能是因为当地的COVID安全限制。
note_en:
Like so many industries, the last five months have been absolutely devastating for movie theaters. As far as sheer volumes go, no one has been harder hit than the world’s largest theater chain.  AMC   has had plans to reopen theaters for some time — but things change, particularly when you’re dealing with something as uncertain and always-evolving as a global pandemic.
  This week, the theater juggernaut announced plans to reopen more than 100 theaters in the U.S. on August 20, constituting a first wave of re-openings. In an attempt to entice understandably cautious customers to return, it will be offering all tickets for $0.15 for one day only (with a limited quantity as it enforces social distancing measures). The number is a momentary return to 1920 ticket prices, as an homage to the chains founding.
  Things are still…tricky, of course. Among the bigger issues here is the current lack of new releases to choose from. It’s one of those chicken and egg deals. Movie studios have been equally eager to release films, but haven’t had much luck as local regulations have kept theaters close. After numerous delays, Warner Bros. announced that it will be taking the unusual measure of premiering Christopher Nolan’s Tenet outside of the U.S. before it comes to the States. More than anything, it’s a clear indication of this country’s handling of the COVID-19.
  With movies like Tenet and The New Mutants waiting in the wings, AMC will be relying on older blockbusters to try to get butts back in seats. Upcoming films include The Empire Strikes Back, Black Panther, Back to the Future, Ghostbusters and Grease. Those will be priced at $5 a pop, designed to lure folks who can’t wait to return the theater experience, new releases or no.
  AMC, of course, was the subject of controversy when it announced that masks would be voluntary for moviegoers, a stance it quickly retracted after intense online backlash. The release noting the reopening includes a laundry list of sanitation and safety measures,
 AMC Safe & Clean components include significant reductions in the maximum tickets available for each showtime and seat blocking in reserved seating auditoriums to allow for appropriate social distancing between parties, enhanced cleaning procedures that include extra time between showtimes to allow for a full, thorough cleaning and nightly disinfecting utilizing electrostatic sprayers, use of high tech HEPA vacuums, upgraded air filtration efforts including the use of MERV 13 filters wherever possible, new guest and associate safety protocols that include mandatory mask wearing by all guests and associates, hand sanitizing stations throughout the theatre, and the availability to guests of disinfectant wipes.
 The list of theaters  can be found here. It’s limited to a handful of cities and states, skipping key markets like California and New York, likely due to local COVID safety restrictions.
title: AMC将在8月20日重新开放100多家美国影院时提供15美分的门票
title_en: AMC will offer 15 cent tickets when it reopens 100+ US theaters on August 20

note:
如今，科技业亿万富翁比尔·盖茨(Bill Gates)似乎比很长时间以来更多地出现在媒体上，但他并不是在谈论他最了解的事情：如何在科技行业赚很多钱，扼杀竞争，并逃脱惩罚。
盖茨将自己插入到围绕医疗危机、冠状病毒流行的辩论中，如果“连线”的语气是可信的，那么他将被视为医疗问题上的“权威消息来源”，某种程度上是一位自以为是的流行病学家。
这种信念可能源于这样一个事实，正如报告所暗示的那样，盖茨过去曾宣布过一场即将到来的大流行，而且“正如他所预测的那样”--但他也被认为是阴谋论和错误信息的受害者。
关于这一点，盖茨被问及如何解释“这么多人”接受被称为“反科学”世界观的事实。但在他的回应中，最重要的是，盖茨抨击了端到端加密-这已经不是他第一次这样做了。看起来，他对网上用户享有的隐私和安全的厌恶，如果不是更强烈的话，就像他自己承认的反对“反科学斗争的一切”的运动一样强烈，如果不是更强烈的话。我与气候变化、转基因生物和疫苗有关。“。
但盖茨很快就从“反科学”转向呼吁政府在私下谈话中取消加密(据推测，这就是批评他的人能够交流他们对他和类似活动的想法和反应的原因)。盖茨再次表示，这种对“虚假信息”的打击对网络的健康和安全至关重要，与“欺诈或儿童色情”相提并论，显然是为了诋毁加密。
这里提到的其中一个有罪的应用程序是Facebook旗下的WhatsApp，而Facebook的所有者是他的朋友马克·扎克伯格(Mark Zuckerberg)。
当被问及他是否与扎克伯格谈过这件事(即关闭Messenger应用程序上的加密)时，盖茨承认，他现在已经把反对加密的战争作为自己的谈话重点，扎克伯格最近说了几乎相同的话后，给他发了电子邮件。
盖茨含糊其辞地说：“他和我确实在涉及的权衡上意见不一。”(很可能指的是安全和隐私之间的权衡，并不惜以任何方式践踏任何他不喜欢的(错误的)信息。)
note_en:
Tech billionaire Bill Gates seems more present in the media these days than he has been for a long time, but he’s not talking about what he knows best: how to make a lot of money in tech, stifle competition, and get away with it.
  Gates is inserting himself in the debate around a medical crisis, the coronavirus epidemic, and if  Wired’s tone is to be believed, he is to be taken as an “authoritative source” on medical issues, as a self-thought epidemiologist of sorts.
  This belief may stem from the fact Gates, as the report suggests, announced an upcoming pandemic in the past, and it happened “just as he predicted” – but he’s also presented as a victim of conspiracy theories and misinformation.
  On that note, Gates was asked how he explains the fact that “so many people” are receptive to what is referred to as “this anti-science” worldview. But in his response, more than anything, Gates takes a swipe at end-to-end encryption – and this is not the first time he’s done that. It appears as if his dislike of privacy and security enjoyed by users online is as strong, if not stronger, than his self-confessed crusade against “everything that anti-science is fighting. I’m involved with climate change, GMOs, and vaccines.”
   But Gates quickly shifts gears from “anti-science” to calling on the government to kill off encryption in private conversations (as supposedly the reason his critics are able to communicate their thoughts and reactions to his and similar activities). And once again, Gates says this crackdown on “misinformation” is essential for the health and security of the web in the same breath as “fraud or child pornography” in an obvious attempt to vilify encryption as such.
  One of the guilty apps mentioned in this context is the Facebook-owned WhatsApp, while Facebook is owned by his friend, Mark Zuckerberg.
  Asked whether he has spoken “about this” (i.e., shuttering encryption on the messenger app) with Zuckerberg, Gates acknowledges that he has made the war on encryption his talking point now, and that Zuckerberg emailed him after he said pretty much the same things recently.
 “He and I do disagree on the trade-offs involved there,” Gates said cryptically (probably referring to the trade-offs between security and privacy, and stomping out any (mis) information he dislikes, by any means.)
title: 比尔·盖茨主张停止端到端加密
title_en: Bill Gates advocates for stopping end-to-end encryption

note:
本周二，英特尔举行了为期一天的虚拟架构日会议，并带领与会者深入探讨了即将推出的所有类别产品的架构：CPU、GPU(专用的和集成的)和FPGA。我们学到了很多关于英特尔一直在做什么以及为什么要做的事情，最具体的细节是关于最即将发布的产品-下个月的老虎湖笔记本电脑处理器。
即使是在一次名为“架构日”的会议上，英特尔也不同寻常地带我们深入了解了它的制造和封装流程。这一天的演讲主要集中在单个晶体管和片内电容器的改进上，就像他们对处理器设计本身的改进一样。
除了纯粹的教育角度，英特尔对低层次设计的关注似乎有两个目的。较低的关注度让英特尔的10 nm制程听起来值得意想不到的漫长等待--这也让英特尔有机会抛弃其制程规模上繁琐的后缀，把整个过程称为更人性化的超级品。
随着14 nm制程已经成功，而10 nm制程已经开始，就连英特尔自己的工程师在相互交谈时也开始感到困惑。因此，这一变化不仅仅对市场营销有好处。SUPERFIN的名字是SuperMIM电容器设计和重新设计的FinFET晶体管的合成词。
谈论整体封装中单个晶体管和电容器的质量的问题是，它很难直接转化为性能。因此，既然我们知道英特尔在较低级别一直在努力工作，那么我们就来看看对大多数人来说更熟悉的设计原则--电压、频率和子处理器。
老虎湖建在柳树湾上，这是一个跟随着冰湖阳光湾的微型建筑。Willow Cove被标榜为对Sunny Cove的重大改进，增加了安全功能，更高的缓存，显著提高了时钟速度。
柳树湾增加的时钟速度并没有耗电的障碍。与Sunny Cove处理器相比，Willow Cove处理器具有更大的动态范围和更高的效率-它们可以在更低和更高的电压下运行，在相同电压下，它们的频率(随电压变化)也更高。
我们也期待极大改进的集成显卡。Ice Lake的Iris+对于英特尔传统上比较弱小的iGPU来说是一剂亟需的强心针，但它仍然远远落后于AMD的Vega11集成笔记本电脑显卡。虎湖取消了Iris+，而是引入了更强壮的Xe LP。
英特尔将其新的Xe显卡系列(包括Xe LP)描述为行业领先-尽管该公司尚未公开谈论基准测试，但我们怀疑这不是开玩笑。泄露的时代间谍基准将显示，老虎湖i7-1165G7在GPU上以显著优势击败AMD的Ryzen 74700U-原始分数的35%。
同样泄露的基准测试有四核/八线程的i7-1165G7和8c/8t的Ryzen 74700U在CPU能力方面处于死气沉沉的状态，得分实际上是难以区分的。值得一提的是，“时代间谍”的线程有限是出了名的--尽管如此，拥有8个内核和16个线程的Ryzen 74800U确实比泄露的i7-1165G7的CPU性能高出34%。
最后，与冰湖相比，老虎湖将能够以更高的分辨率驱动更多的显示器，并在更大的分辨率管道上处理人工智能工作负载。
我们实际上还没有拿到虎湖的任何部件，制造商声称和完全实现的、独立测试的系统之间存在着巨大的差异。但英特尔实际上正在渗出新的信心，并做出大胆的声明，尽管还为时过早。似乎可以肯定的是，虎湖笔记本电脑CPU将成为AMD Ryzen 4000的激烈竞争对手--冰湖和彗星湖都不是这样。
真正有趣的问题--也是英特尔仍在守口如瓶的问题--是英特尔将能够向原始设备制造商提供多少老虎湖CPU。该公司的发言人说，我们在冰湖看到的10纳米供应问题已经得到解决--但他们没有对这意味着什么给出太多定义。
当我们进一步追问英特尔高管时，我们得到的确认是，彗星湖不会重演-第11代移动部件将只有10 nm，不会发布与之竞争的14 nm产品。但对于OEM选择购买什么以及购买多久，这一声明伴随着一些特别谨慎的对冲。这可能只是一种谨慎，也可能是一种迹象，表明老虎湖只会出现在相对较低的高端系统中，就像冰湖一样。
note_en:
This Tuesday, Intel held an all-day virtual "Architecture Day" conference and took attendees on a deep dive into the architecture of upcoming products in all categories: CPUs, GPUs (dedicated and integrated), and FPGAs. We learned a lot about what Intel's been working on and why, with the most concrete details being about the most imminent release—next month's Tiger Lake laptop processors.
     Even for a conference called "Architecture Day," Intel took us unusually deep into its manufacturing and packaging processes. The day's presentations leaned as heavily on improvements in the individual transistors and capacitors on-die as they did on improvements in the processor designs themselves.
 Aside from the purely educational angle, Intel's focus on the lower levels of design appeared to serve two purposes. The lower-level focus made Intel's 10nm process sound worth the unexpectedly long wait—and it gave Intel a chance to ditch the ponderous "++" suffixes to its process size and dub the whole thing a more human-friendly "SuperFin."
 With the 14nm process having hit "++++" and the 10nm already on "++," even Intel's own engineers were starting to get confused when talking to one another. So the change is good for more than just marketing. The SuperFin name is a portmanteau of "SuperMIM capacitor design" and "redesigned FinFET transistors."
     The problem with talking about the quality of individual transistors and capacitors in an overall package is that it's difficult to translate directly to performance. So, now that we know Intel's been working hard at the lower levels, we move on to design principles that are a little more familiar to most—voltages, frequencies, and subprocessors.
 Tiger Lake is built upon Willow Cove, the microarchitecture which follows Ice Lake's Sunny Cove. Willow Cove is billed as a significant improvement to Sunny Cove all the way around, with added security features, higher cache, and significantly improved clock speeds.
 Willow Cove's added clock speed doesn't come with a power consumption handicap. Willow Cove processors have both a larger dynamic range and higher efficiency than Sunny Cove processors did—they can operate at both lower and higher voltages, and their frequencies (which scale with voltage) are higher at the same voltage as well.
 We're also looking forward to immensely improved integrated graphics. Ice Lake's Iris+ was a much-needed shot in the arm for Intel's traditionally wimpy iGPUs, but it still lagged significantly behind AMD's Vega 11 integrated laptop graphics. Tiger Lake does away with Iris+ and introduces the much beefier Xe LP instead.
 Intel describes its new line of Xe graphics, including Xe LP, as "industry leading"—and although the company isn't talking benchmarks publicly yet, we suspect it's not kidding. Leaked Time Spy  benchmarks show a Tiger Lake i7-1165G7 beating AMD's Ryzen 7 4700U on GPUs by a significant margin—35 percent of the raw score.
 The same leaked benchmarks have the four-core / eight-thread i7-1165G7 and the 8c/8t Ryzen 7 4700U in a dead heat for CPU prowess, with effectively indistinguishable scores. It's worth noting here that Time Spy is notoriously thread-limited—despite which the Ryzen 7 4800U, with eight cores and 16 threads, does beat the leaked i7-1165G7's CPU score by 34 percent.
 Finally, Tiger Lake will be able to drive more displays at higher resolutions—and handle AI workloads on larger resolution pipelines—than Ice Lake could.
     We haven't actually gotten our hands on any Tiger Lake parts yet, and there's a world of difference between manufacturer claims and fully realized, independently tested systems. But Intel is practically oozing renewed confidence and making bold, if early, claims. It seems like a safe bet that Tiger Lake laptop CPUs will be serious competition for AMD's Ryzen 4000—which neither Ice Lake nor Comet Lake really were.
 The really interesting question—and one which Intel is still being cagey about—is how many Tiger Lake CPUs Intel will be able to supply to OEMs. The company's presenters said that the 10nm supply problems we saw in Ice Lake had been "overcome"—but they didn't give much definition of what that meant.
 When we pressed Intel executives further, we received confirmation that there won't be a repeat of Comet Lake—11th-generation mobile parts will be 10nm only, with no competing 14nm announcement. But that declaration came with some notably cautious hedges about what OEMs choose to buy and for how long. This could just be caution, or it could be an indication that Tiger Lake will only be seen in relatively low-volume, high-end systems in much the same way Ice Lake was.
title: 英特尔的虎湖处理器已准备好与Ryzen 4000移动设备竞争
title_en: Intel’s Tiger Lake CPUs are ready to take on Ryzen 4000 mobile

note:
该公司的一些最著名的活动包括会见米歇尔·奥巴马，会见“星球大战”的演员，并参观“星际迷航：超越星际迷航”的布景。(我承认我把帽子放在戒指上买了最后一件。)。但联合创始人兼首席执行官马特·波尔森表示，近年来，奥梅兹的模式已经从“人才活动”转变为包括提供诸如Airstream大篷车或博拉博拉四季度假村(Four Seasons Resort In Bora Bora)等奖品的筹款活动。
鲍尔森说，他对这款车型感兴趣是在一次竞选活动中，他与丹尼尔·克雷格(Daniel Craig)会面并赢得了一辆阿斯顿·马丁(Aston Martin)，这让他怀疑阿斯顿·马丁本身是否会有足够大的吸引力。在那之后不久，也就是2018年，他在手术期间有过一次濒死体验，他说这只会坚定他推动公司走向新方向的信念。
鲍尔森回忆说，外科医生告诉他，他平躺了四分半钟，存活的机会非常低，他之所以能挺过来，是因为和他一起在房间里的家人发出的“爱和乐观”。
他说：“因为我获得了200万个机会中的一个，我想把这些机会尽可能多地投放到世界上。”“我们做到这一点的方式是通过我们筹集的资金和我们传播的乐观情绪。用人才这样做会限制可伸缩性。“。
此外，通过组织自己的活动，Omaze团队可以“选择我们热衷的事业”，而不是局限于名人想要支持的事业。
与此同时，波尔森急忙补充说，如果没有吸引了大量用户基础的明星的帮助，奥梅兹永远不可能朝着这个方向发展，他表示，公司也在继续开展人才宣传活动-这只是更大战略的一部分。
有了新冠肺炎，该公司不得不推迟一些奖项。毕竟，名人见面会和精心策划的度假之旅现在没有多大意义，但鲍尔森说，“人们明白这一点。”总体而言，这场流行病实际上增加了人们的兴趣，给了人们“更深层次的回馈欲望”，同时也让他们“比以往任何时候都更想梦想”。
Pohlson说，在过去的18个月里，奥马兹战役的平均业绩翻了四番，同时收入增长了500%。
奥梅兹此前在首轮融资中筹集了1200万美元。新一轮融资由FirstMark Capital牵头，参与机构包括Causeway Media Partners、BDMI、Tusk Ventures、Inherent Group、Gaingels、Penni Thow‘s Cu和Guy Oseary。Thow和凯尔特人老板Wyc Grousbeck将加入公司董事会。
Tow在一份声明中说：“Omaze作为体验捐赠和社会影响的领导者，在赋予改变世界的慈善机构权力方面的能力是无与伦比的。”作为奥马兹董事会的一名新成员，随着他们继续扩大新类别并进一步在国际上扩张，我对支持他们的增长感到无比兴奋。“。
更多关于这些增长计划的信息：鲍尔森说，奥梅兹从汽车开始扩张后，最近又推出了豪华住宅活动。它将使用新的资金来扩大这些活动，同时还会引入更多的活动类别。他还指出，该公司最近在英国成立，计划向西欧和亚洲扩张。
尽管Omaze已经为慈善事业筹集了超过1.3亿美元，但Pohlson表示，他的一个大目标是使其成为第一家捐赠10亿美元的营利性公司。
“我们希望为其他社会企业家铺平道路，”他说。“在能够为世界做好事和拥有大量经济机会之间，似乎存在这种错误的选择。我们的文化很难让人们因做好事而得到奖励。(在奥梅兹)我们认为，这阻碍了人们行善。“
note_en:
Some of the company’s best-known campaigns include opportunities to meet  Michelle Obama, meet  Star Wars cast members and  visit the set of “Star Trek Beyond.” (I’ll admit that I thew my hat in the ring for that last one.) But co-founder and CEO Matt Pohlson said that in recent years, the Omaze model has shifted away from “talent campaigns” to include fundraisers offering prizes like  an Airstream Caravel or  a trip to the Four Seasons resort in Bora Bora.
 Pohlson said that he became interested in this model after a campaign combining a chance to  meet Daniel Craig and win an Aston Martin, which made him wonder whether the Aston Martin would be a big enough draw on its own. Shortly after that, in 2018, he had a near-death experience during surgery, which he said only strengthened his conviction to move the company in a new direction.
  Pohlson recalled the surgeon telling him that he’d flat-lined for four-and-a-half minutes, with extremely low chances for survival, and that he only pulled through because of the “love and optimism” coming from the family members in the room with him.
 “Because of the one-in-2-million chance I’m getting, I want to put as much of that out in the world as I can,” he said. “The way we do that is through the money we raise and the optimism we spread. Doing that with talent limits the scalability.”
 Plus, by organizing its own campaigns, the  Omaze   team gets to “pick the causes we’re passionate about,” rather than being limited to the causes that celebrities want to support.
  At the same time, Pohlson hastened to add that Omaze would never have been able to move in this direction without the help of stars who attracted a big user base, and he said the company continues to pursue talent campaigns as well — they’re just one part of a larger strategy.
 With COVID-19, the company had to delay some of its prizes. After all, celebrity meetings and elaborate vacation getaways don’t make a lot of sense right now, but Pohlson said, “People get it.” And overall, the pandemic has actually increased interest, giving people “a deeper desire to give back” while also making them “want to dream more than ever.”
 The performance of the average Omaze campaign has quadrupled over the past 18 months, Pohlson said, while revenue has increased by 500%.
 Omaze previously raised $12 million in Series A funding. The new round was led by  FirstMark Capital,   with participation from Causeway Media Partners, BDMI, Tusk Ventures, Inherent Group, Gaingels, Penni Thow’s Copper and Guy Oseary. Thow and Celtics owner Wyc Grousbeck are joining the company’s board of directors.
 “Omaze is unmatched in their ability to empower world-changing charities as a leader in experiencial giving and social impact,” Thow said in a statement. “As a new member of the Omaze board, I couldn’t be more excited to support their growth as they continue to scale new categories and expand further internationally.”
 More about those growth plans: Pohlson said that after Omaze’s expansion started with cars, it recently launched luxury home campaigns. It will use the new funding to expand those campaigns while also introducing additional campaign categories. He also noted that the company recently launched in the United Kingdom, with plans to expand into Western Europe and Asia.
 And although Omaze has already raised more $130 million for charity, Pohlson said that one of his big goals is to make it the first for-profit company to donate $1 billion.
 “We want to pave the way for other social entrepreneurs,” he said. “There seems to have this false choice between being able to do good in the world and also having a lot of economic opportunity. Our culture has trouble with people being rewarded for doing good. [At Omaze,] we think that holds back people from doing good.”
title: 奥梅兹在名人活动之外扩张后筹集了3000万美元
title_en: Omaze raises $30M after expanding beyond celebrity campaigns

note:
Keeper Security的平台承诺防止与密码相关的数据泄露和网络威胁，该公司预计将在本周某个时候完成一轮6000万美元的增长融资(但尚未正式结束)。该公司表示，将利用这笔资金加快上市努力，并在全球范围内获得新客户。
数据泄露可能会对企业造成严重影响。根据IBM的数据，全球数据泄露的平均成本为390万美元，上市公司的典型泄密成本估计为1.16亿美元。这些入侵绝大多数是可以预防的-咨询公司Willis Towers Watson发现，超过90%的网络安全漏洞是由于人为错误造成的。但超过77%的组织没有事件应对计划，大多数目标甚至需要六个月的时间才能发现大规模违规行为。
Keeper的平台旨在通过为网站和应用程序创建随机、高强度的密码来降低数据泄露的风险，这些网站和应用程序存放在跨设备的安全金库中。每位员工都有一个私人的加密保管库，用于存储和管理他们的密码、凭证、文件和私人客户端数据。(员工可以加密任何类型的文件或元数据，包括私钥、数字证书、笔记、列表、代码、机密文档和媒体文件。)。从这些文件夹中，他们可以与团队或个人用户共享文件和密码，并自定义权限。员工还可以访问其记录的历史记录、查看以前的版本和更改，以及按需恢复记录。
Keeper还提供跨平台的加密消息服务-KeeperChat-on设备上的群聊、受保护的媒体集，以及在聊天和附件上收回和计划自毁计时器的能力。有一个报告和警报模块，以及一个名为BreachWatch的黑暗网络监控工具，它提供对保险库中密码的风险评估，并提供密码被攻破状态的摘要视图。与远程连接工具的集成使Keeper能够在远程会话中自动填充Vault中的密码和其他信息，而客户隔离功能允许用户通过合规性、报告和控制独立调配、管理和监控多个客户。
Keeper用于个人安全的单独产品允许用户添加最多五个亲密联系人，以便在紧急情况下授予金库访问权限。个性化字段协调了驾照、支付卡和护照等信息与现有记录的组织，而双因素身份验证则提供了更高的安全性。
Keeper声称在100多个国家拥有“数百万”个人客户和数千名商业客户，其中许多人是在过去一年内加入该平台的。首席执行官达伦·古奇奥尼表示，这轮投资由Insight Partners牵头，是该公司成立以来的第一轮投资，将使Keeper能够在2019年雇佣的120名团队成员的基础上再增加一名。
note_en:
Keeper Security, whose platform promises to prevent password-related data breaches and cyberthreats, expects to close (but hasn’t yet officially closed) a $60 million growth financing round sometime this week. The company says it will use the funds to accelerate its go-to-market efforts and acquire new customers globally.
 Data breaches can be crippling for businesses. According to  IBM, the global average cost of data compromise is $3.9 million, and typical breaches at publicly traded companies are  estimated to cost $116 million. The vast majority of these breaches are preventable — consultancy Willis Towers Watson  finds that over 90% of cybersecurity breaches are due to human error. But more than 77% of organizations don’t have an incident response  plan, and  most targets take six months to detect even large breaches.
  Keeper’s platform aims to mitigate the risk of data breaches by creating random, high-strength passwords for websites and apps it stows in secure vaults across devices. Each employee gets a private, encrypted vault for storing and managing their passwords, credentials, files, and private client data. (Employees can encrypt any type of file or metadata, including private keys, digital certificates, notes, lists, codes, confidential documents, and media files.) From these folders, they’re able to share files and passwords with teams or individual users and customize permissions. Employees can also access a history of their records, view previous versions and changes, and recover records on demand.
  Keeper also offers a cross-platform encrypted messaging service — KeeperChat — on devices with group chats, a protected media gallery, and the ability to retract and schedule self-destruct timers on chats and attachments. There’s a reporting and alerts module, and a dark web monitoring tool called BreachWatch that provides a risk assessment of passwords in vaults and a summary view of breached password status. Integrations with remote connection tools enable Keeper to autofill passwords and other info from vaults in remote sessions, while a customer isolation feature allows users to independently provision, manage, and monitor multiple customers with compliance, reporting, and control.
 Keeper’s separate product for personal security lets users add up to five close contacts to grant vault access in the event of an emergency. Personalized fields orchestrate the organization of information like driver’s licenses, payment cards, and passports with existing records, while two-factor authentication provides added security.
 Keeper claims to have “millions” of individual customers and thousands of business clients in over 100 countries, many of whom joined the platform within the past year. CEO Darren Guccione says this investment round, which was led by Insight Partners and is the company’s first since its founding, will enable Keeper to add to the 120 team members it hired in 2019.
title: Keeper Security提供防止密码相关数据泄露和网络威胁的软件，由Insight Partners牵头筹集6000万美元
title_en: Keeper Security, which offers software to prevent password-related data breaches and cyberthreats, raises $60M round led by Insight Partners

note:
英特尔2020年架构日首次展示了该公司即将推出的Tiger Lake处理器，并更详细地预览了英特尔利用即将推出的Xe显卡打造自己的GPU-这两款显卡都承诺提供比以往更高的性能和更低的功耗。
这些新产品对英特尔来说是一件大事，原因有几个。英特尔在过去几年被迫采取守势，来自AMD的竞争加剧；其最近推出的7纳米Ryzen 4000芯片从制造角度来看已经领先于英特尔的10 nm Ice Lake芯片，而且在很多情况下，在笔记本电脑方面的表现都超过了英特尔的产品。英特尔还面临着来自ARM的压力，随着微软、三星和苹果等大公司开始提供ARM电脑，ARM开始削弱英特尔对主要计算领域的控制。
当然，英特尔最近宣布将其7纳米芯片推迟到至少2022年-这对其即将发布的硬件来说是一个重大挫折。英特尔需要在今年秋天大获全胜，向它的合作伙伴和消费者展示为什么它仍然是处理器世界中一支不可忽视的力量。
该公司即将推出的Tiger Lake芯片(根据该公司目前的品牌计划，预计将成为英特尔的第11代酷睿处理器)是英特尔试图反击其日益激烈的竞争。它由该公司新的Willow Cove架构提供动力，该架构建立在一种新的“超级”晶体管上，该公司承诺，这种晶体管将提供完全节点转移所能提供的代际增长。这是一个很大的承诺，但如果虎湖能够实现这一承诺，考虑到7 nm的延迟，这对英特尔来说可能是至关重要的。
老虎湖芯片将提供显著更好的频率速度，同时也消耗相当少的电力。
然而，新的10纳米超级芯片设计的结果是，英特尔承诺老虎湖芯片将提供显著更好的频率速度，同时也消耗相当少的电力。这意味着英特尔将能够提供与今天的Ice Lake芯片相同的电压水平下提供大幅性能提升的芯片，或者在降低功耗的同时提供类似的频率。
Tiger Lake还将支持多种新的开箱即用的I/O标准，包括迅雷4和USB4、高达5400 MHz的DDR5 RAM(除了DDR4高达3200 MHz和LPDDR4X高达4767 MHz)，以及PCIe Gen 4.0(为内存提供高达8 GB/秒的速度)。
虎湖也将是英特尔Xe显卡的首次公开亮相-特别是第一代英特尔Xe-LP集成显卡，它将提供高达96 EU(增加50%)，并承诺在性能和功耗方面与目前提供的第10代Ice Lake芯片提供的Gen 11显卡提供类似的大幅增长。
Xe-LP显卡显然将在整个英特尔阵容中为游戏提供巨大的改进(特别是在那些通常不专注于游戏的设备上)。英特尔展示了现代的aaa游戏，如绝地求生，网格，毁灭永恒和战场V，在集成的Xe-LP显卡上以1080p的速度平稳运行，并指出以前只能在25W系统上运行的游戏现在可以在15W的Xe-LP系统上运行。
XE-LP还承诺为创作者提供更好的性能和显示性能，支持高达8K超高清的HDR10和杜比视觉面板，高达360 Hz的刷新率，以及高达两倍的视频编码和解码性能。
但Xe-LP只是英特尔图形战略的一部分。该公司还提供了Xe-HP的更新，Xe-HP是其图形架构的更高性能版本，通过演示展示了其视频编码技能，并承诺将于2021年发布窗口。英特尔宣布了另一个图形微架构：XE-HPG，它将专门专注于游戏，可能代表着英特尔第一次积极与AMD和NVIDIA争夺专注于游戏的GPU。XE-HPG希望结合其他XE架构的各个方面，并将能够在明年开始发货时提供GPU加速的光线跟踪。
该公司还宣布，它已经开始生产DG1独立显卡(基于将在老虎湖(Tiger Lake)推出的相同的Xe-LP技术)，将于今年晚些时候发货。这款GPU并不是你通常会将其与名字联系在一起的那种高端显卡。它实际上就是集成的图形处理器，英特尔将与泰格湖一起出货，作为外部卡提供，允许更好的散热。这更像是对英特尔独立GPU雄心的概念验证(如上所述，这是广泛的)，而不是图形领域的下一件大事。
最后，英特尔预告了其2021年路线图的下一波浪潮。其传统微架构的下一步是其10 nm Golden Cove内核，该内核承诺进一步提高性能，进行AI和5G优化，并提高安全性。Golden Cove将是新宣布的Alder Lake系列的关键部分，Alder Lake系列是一款注重性能的混合芯片组，将接替最近发布的Lakefield混合芯片。
目前的Lakefield芯片采用与ARM的Big.LITTLE技术类似的方法，将速度更快、更耗电的内核与更小的内核相结合，以实现更高的性能和更高的效率。今天的单芯级Sunny Cove内核(与第十代冰湖芯片所基于的10 nm架构相同)具有四个低功耗Atom级Tremont内核，Alder Lake将把Golden Cove内核与Gracemont(下一代Atom内核，将接替Tremont)相结合，以实现更好的性能和更低的功耗。这可能意味着Alder Lake未来可能会转向性能更高的笔记本电脑，甚至是台式机。
请记住：今天的新闻只是英特尔即将推出的硬件的高级技术展望。期待在9月2日全面展示新的Tiger Lake芯片(将采用集成Xe-LP显卡)。
note_en:
Intel’s Architecture Day 2020 brought a first look at the company’s upcoming Tiger Lake processors, along with a more detailed preview of Intel’s foray into building its own GPUs with its upcoming Xe graphics — both of which promise to offer higher performance and lower power consumption than ever before.
  These new products are a big deal for Intel for a few reasons. Intel’s been forced on the defensive the past few years, with  heightened competition from AMD; its recent 7nm Ryzen 4000 chips are already ahead of Intel’s 10nm Ice Lake chips from a manufacturing standpoint and, in many cases,  outperform Intel’s offerings in laptops. Intel is also facing pressure from ARM, which is starting to chip away at Intel’s control over the major computing space, with major companies like  Microsoft, Samsung, and  Apple beginning to offer ARM computers.
 And of course, Intel recently announced that it’d be delaying its 7nm chips  until at least 2022 — a major setback for its upcoming hardware releases. Intel needs a big win this fall, to show its partners and consumers alike why it’s still a force to be reckoned with in the processor world.
   The company’s  upcoming Tiger Lake chips (expected to be Intel’s 11th Gen Core processors under the company’s current branded scheme) are Intel’s attempt to fight back against its increased competition. It’s powered by the company’s new Willow Cove architecture, which is built on a new “SuperFin” transistor that the company promises will offer a generational type of increase that a full node shift would have offered. That’s a big promise to make, but if Tiger Lake can meet that, it could be critical for Intel, given the 7nm delay.
 Tiger Lake chips will offer dramatically better frequency speeds, while also drawing considerably less power
 The result of the new 10nm SuperFin design, though, is that Intel promises Tiger Lake chips will offer dramatically better frequency speeds, while also drawing considerably less power. That means Intel will be able to offer chips that provide big performance boosts at the same voltage levels as today’s Ice Lake chips or offer comparable frequency rates while reducing power consumption.
   Tiger Lake will also support a variety of new I/O standards out of the box, including  Thunderbolt 4 and  USB4,  DDR5 RAM at up to 5400MHz (in addition to DDR4 at up to 3200MHz and LPDDR4X at up to 4767MHz), and  PCIe Gen 4.0 (offering speeds of up to 8GB per second to memory).
  Tiger Lake will also be the public debut of Intel’s Xe graphics — specifically the first generation of Intel’s Xe-LP integrated graphics, which will offer up to 96 EUs (a 50 percent increase) and promises to provide similarly substantial increases over the current Gen11 graphics offered alongside its 10th Gen Ice Lake chips in both improved performance and lower power consumption.
 The Xe-LP graphics will obviously offer big improvements to gaming across Intel’s lineup (especially on devices that aren’t typically focused on gaming). Intel showcased modern AAA games like  PUBG,  Grid,  Doom Eternal, and  Battlefield V running smoothly at 1080p on integrated Xe-LP graphics and noted that games that only ran on a 25W system with Gen11 were now achievable on a 15W system with Xe-LP.
   Xe-LP also promises better performance for creators and display performance, with support for up to 8K UHD with HDR10 and Dolby vision panels, up to 360Hz refresh rates, and up to two times the performance for encoding and decoding video.
 But Xe-LP is only a part of Intel’s graphics strategy. The company also offered an update on its Xe-HP, the higher-powered version of its graphics architecture, with a demo showing off its video-encoding skills and promising a 2021 release window. Intel announced another graphics microarchitecture: Xe-HPG, which will focus specifically on gaming and might represent Intel’s first foray into actively competing with AMD and Nvidia for gaming-focused GPUs. Xe-HPG looks to combine aspects of the other Xe architectures and will be able to offer GPU-accelerated ray tracing when it starts shipping next year.
   The company also announced that it has started production of its  DG1 discrete graphics card (based on the same Xe-LP technology that’ll be featured in Tiger Lake), which is set to ship later this year. That GPU isn’t really the kind of high-end graphics card that you’d typically associate with the name. It’s effectively just the integrated GPU that Intel will be shipping with Tiger Lake offered as an external card, allowing for better cooling. It’s more of a proof-of-concept for Intel’s discrete GPU ambitions (which, as mentioned above, are extensive) than the next big thing in graphics.
 Lastly, Intel previewed the  next wave of its roadmap for 2021. Up next for its traditional microarchitectures is its 10nm Golden Cove cores, which promises further performance improvements, AI and 5G optimization, and increased security. Golden Cove will be a key part of the newly announced Alder Lake series, which is a performance-focused hybrid chipset that will succeed the  recently released Lakefield hybrid chips.
   The current Lakefield chips take a similar approach to  ARM’s BIG.little technology, combining a mix of faster, more power-hungry core for performance with smaller cores for better efficiency. Today’s single Core-class Sunny Cove core (the same 10nm architecture the 10th Gen Ice Lake chips are based on) with four low-power Atom-class Tremont cores, Alder Lake will combine Golden Cove cores with Gracemont (the next-generation Atom cores, set to succeed Tremont) for even better performance and lower power consumption. That could potentially mean that Alder Lake could be coming to higher-powered laptops or even desktops in the future.
 And remember: today’s news is only a high-level, technical look at Intel’s upcoming hardware.  Expect a full reveal of the new Tiger Lake chips (which will feature integrated Xe-LP graphics)  on September 2nd.
tags: 显卡,英特尔,性能,下一代,offers
title: 英特尔首次展示了其下一代Tiger Lake处理器和Xe显卡，这两款处理器都承诺提供更高的性能和更低的功耗
title_en: Intel offers a first look at its next-gen Tiger Lake processors and Xe graphics, both of which promise to offer higher performance and lower power consumption
